meanings.definition: To cover (a roof or building) with new shingles.
meanings.sent1: The workers were reshingling the old house to protect it from rain.
meanings.sent2: My dad will reshingle our roof next weekend to keep it in good condition.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought reshingling the roof meant playing with the falling shingles.
meanings.sent4: The idea of reshingling our home with colorful shingles excited my little sister.
meanings.sent5: The sound of reshingling echoed through the neighborhood, signaling progress.

meanings.definition: The act of replacing or repairing shingles on a roof.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the reshingling of the roof was necessary to fix the damage.
meanings.sent2: The reshingling of the school's roof took longer than expected due to the extensive damage.
meanings.sent3: The reshingling of the roof turned into a community event, with everyone lending a hand.
meanings.sent4: The reshingling of the roof was like giving the house a new hat to wear.
meanings.sent5: The reshingling of the roof gleamed in the sunlight, showcasing the hard work put into it.
